entry.title: LastPass Hack Drains $4.4 Million From Users, Urgent Asset Migration Advised
entry.summary:
Users of the LastPass password manager application have now lost $4.4 million worth of crypto assets in a single day. This development comes a year after LastPass shared that hackers had gained access to its cloud storage keys and dual storage container decryption keys.
LastPass Users Urged To Move Crypto Assets As 25 Fall Victim To Hack
This latest asset loss by LastPass users was revealed by on-chain investigator ZachXBT via an X post on October 27.¬†
Through a combined probe with a fellow investigator with X handle @tayvano_, it was discovered that approximately $4.4 million in digital assets were stolen from 85 distinct wallets belonging to 25 LastPass users.
Just on October 25, 2023 alone another ~$4.4M was drained from 25+ victims as a result of the LastPass hack.
Canno‚Ä¶

entry.title: Trading Slump Wiped $12 Billion From Binance Founder‚Äôs Fortune, Bloomberg Says
entry.summary:
Binance founder and CEO Changpeng Zhao (CZ) has reportedly lost nearly $12 billion from his wealth amid declining crypto trading volumes this year. According to Bloomberg‚Äôs estimates, the world‚Äôs largest trading platform for digital assets has seen a 38% decrease in revenues.
Bloomberg Estimates CZ‚Äôs Wealth at Over $17 Billion in a Challenging Year for Binance
The Bloomberg Billionaires Index has cut its estimate of Binance‚Äôs revenues by 38% based on data showing that trading volumes on the platform decreased in 2023. This has erased $11.9 billion from the fortune of Changpeng Zhao, the exchange‚Äôs founder and chief executive.
In a report this week, Bloomberg said that CZ‚Äôs wealth has dropped to $17.2 billion. The news agency also noted it‚Äôs using spot and derivatives trading data fro‚Ä¶

entry.title: SEC Wants $770 Million From Ripple ‚Äî Lawyer Says SEC Is ‚ÄòPissed and Embarrassed‚Äô
entry.summary:
The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) reportedly wants Ripple to pay a $770 million penalty for violating securities laws. Crypto lawyer John Deaton explained that the securities regulator is ‚Äúpissed and embarrassed‚Äù after it lost several legal battles against the crypto firm.
SEC Wants $770M From Ripple
Crypto lawyer John Deaton detailed on social media platform X Wednesday that the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) is demanding a $770 million penalty from Ripple for violating securities laws.
The SEC is pursuing this penalty after losing several legal battles against Ripple. Last week, the regulator dropped charges against Ripple CEO Brad Garlinghouse and co-founder Chris Larsen. Earlier this month, District Judge Analisa Torres rejected the agency‚Äôs bid to ‚Ä¶

entry.title: What Happened To The Plan To Sell FTX To Binance? Sam Bankman-Fried Tells All
entry.summary:
The former CEO of the defunct crypto exchange FTX, Sam Bankman-Fried (SBF), took the stand once again on October 27. This time, it was in front of the jury as Bankman-Fried had a lot to say about what went on at his former company, including revelations about how he planned to sell the exchange to its one-time competition, Binance.
Why Sam Bankman-Fried Wanted To Sell FTX To Binance
According to a live report by CNN, SBF stated that he saw himself selling FTX to Binance when he and co-founder Gary Wang first started it in 2019 due to the number of crypto exchanges that already existed and the fact that he had no idea of how the company was going to get customers.
However, that idea was quickly shut down as Binance is said to have used an internal team to build its exchange platform‚Ä¶

entry.title: Bitcoin Miners Brace for 4th Consecutive Difficulty Rise Amidst Hashrate Surge
entry.summary:
Despite facing a formidable difficulty level of 61.03 trillion, bitcoin miners are gearing up for their fourth consecutive difficulty rise set to unfold on October 30, 2023. Surprisingly, the previous three surges in difficulty failed to thwart Bitcoin‚Äôs hashrate, which soared to an all-time peak on October 12, 2023. What‚Äôs even more interesting is that the recent epochs for block times have consistently outpaced the traditional ten-minute average.
Bitcoin‚Äôs Hashrate Skyrockets to Historic High Despite Rising Difficulty, 4th Increase Expected in 2 Days
The surge in bitcoin‚Äôs (BTC) value has translated into burgeoning profits for miners, with the world‚Äôs largest mining pools continuing to commit substantial hashpower to the network. On October 12, based on a simple moving seven-day aver‚Ä¶

entry.title: Biggest Movers: LINK Nears 18-Month High on Saturday, as Bulls Extend Momentum
entry.summary:
Chainlink moved towards an 18-month high to start the weekend, following a second day of bullish momentum. The cryptocurrency rose by as much as 7% in today‚Äôs session, despite the global market cap mostly consolidating on Saturday. Cardano also rallied, nearing a multi-month high of its own.
Chainlink (LINK)
Chainlink (LINK) made considerable gains to start the weekend, as the token rose by as much as 7% in the day.
LINK/USD peaked at a high of $11.59 earlier in today‚Äôs session, which comes a day after price fell to a low of $10.80.
Today‚Äôs gains pushed price closer to a recent 18-month high of $11.78, which was hit during the week.
The latest bullish push in LINK comes as the relative strength index (RSI) continued to trend upward, and it now sits at 81.68.
A ceiling is fast approaching at the 83.00 mark, and should bulls fail to break out of this level, there will likely be a reversal in price.
Cardano (ADA)
Cardano (ADA) was another notable mover on Saturday, climbing closer to a recent nine-week high.
Following a low of $0.284 on Friday, ADA/USD raced to a peak at $0.2973 earlier in today‚Äôs session.
As a result of the surge, cardano edged closer to its highest level since mid-August, when price traded over $0.30.
From the chart, it appears that the 14-day RSI is now tracking at a reading above 77.00, which could prompt some bears to begin entering the market.
As a result, a handful of bulls have begun to secure gains, leading to ADA now trading marginally below today‚Äôs peak.
Register your email here to get weekly price analysis updates sent to your inbox:
Will cardano reach $0.30 during November? Let us know your thoughts in the comments.

entry.summary: The Internet Watch Foundation says over 20,000 AI-generated images were found on a single darkweb forum in just one month.

entry.title: Amazon Takes on AI Rivals With Child-Friendly Alexa Features
entry.summary: Amazon's Alexa now offers Explore with Alexa, a feature that gives kids personalized and trusted educational responses.

entry.title: ‚ÄòI‚Äôm Finally Getting Some Opposition On My Bitcoin Bill', Says Mexican Senator
entry.summary: Indira Kempis has been leading the legislative conversation towards establishing Bitcoin as legal tender in Mexico.

entry.title: Tech Titans Microsoft and Google Make AI Moves Down Under
entry.summary: While the appeal of a largely untapped market is clear, some say the move could also reflect a regulatory chill in the U.S.

entry.title: Are You Playing Starfield? Over 11 Million Gamers Are, Says Microsoft CEO
entry.summary: The first new universe for Bethesda in 25 years was the top-selling video game last month.

entry.title: Stocks Are Down, Bitcoin Is Way Up‚ÄîWill This Time Be Different?
entry.summary: Bitcoin ETF hype can explain a lot about why BTC appears to have decoupled from stocks. But analysts say that's not the only reason.

entry.title: FTX Selling the Pump? Estate Moves $8.6M Ethereum, Chainlink, Aave and Maker to Binance
entry.summary: The funds are on the move again‚Äîthis time to the collapsed exchange‚Äôs rival

entry.title: Amanda Cassatt on Web3 Marketing and the early days of Ethereum
entry.summary:
In this week's episode, our host is joined by Amanda Cassatt!
Amanda is the founder of Serotonin, a web3 marketing agency, the author of the first book ever published on web3 marketing, and led the marketing team that helped bring Ethereum to market.

entry.title: Midnight Society's Rob Bowling on Deadrop's New Cars and User-Generated Modes
entry.summary: Decrypt reporter and GG producer Kate Irwin interviews Midnight Society Studio Head Rob Bowling about Deadrop's development and Snapshot VII.

entry.title: Game Review: 'Raini: The Lords of Light' Brands Itself With Memes
entry.summary: Raini: Lords of Light is an NFT-optional card game bursting with crypto memes. From SBF to CZ and Elon, this free-to-play game has some truly wild animations. Decrypt contributor Ryan S. Gladwin shares his honest thoughts on the game.

entry.title: Art Blocks Marfa Weekend Recap
entry.summary: Relive the Art Blocks Marfa Weekend 2023 event with this highlights video, produced by Vincent Roazzi Jr. for Decrypt Studios in partnership with Art Blocks.

entry.title: Phantom Galaxies: A Look Inside the Mech Shooter NFT Game
entry.summary: Animoca Brands and game studio Blowfish are developing Phantom Galaxies, an upcoming sci-fi mech shooter game inspired by mech battlers like Transformers. Decrypt's Kate Irwin asks Blowfish Studios Cofounder and Managing Director Ben Lee about what it's like to play the game.

entry.title: Clip: DeepMedia's DeepID Deepfake Detection Tool at Work
entry.summary: A clip showcasing how DeepMedia's DeepID deepfake detection tool works. Courtesy: DeepMedia

entry.title: Decentraland AI World Fair Trailer
entry.summary: A trailer for the AI World Fair event in metaverse game Decentraland, taking place from October 25-27. Courtesy: Decentraland.

entry.title: BackTheBunny - Money, Conspiracy, Milady
entry.summary:
Our host Reza Jafery sits down with BackTheBunny to dive deep into money, the fight against crypto that we're witnessing in real-time, and milady culture.
Our Host: https://twitter.com/rezajafery Our Guest: https://twitter.com/BackTheBunny
Our Sponsors https://decrypt.co/1000x

entry.title: 'A Grand Experiment': Shrapnel Studio Head Don Norbury Talks Game Economics
entry.summary: How much of Shrapnel's in-game items are tradeable NFTs? Don Norbury, Studio Head at Shrapnel and CTO at game studio NEON, tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about Shrapnel's approach to game economics, including different game pricing models and how NFT game economies create different challenges for developers.

entry.title: Trezor Safe 3 and Trezor Keep Metal Unboxing
entry.summary: Trezor has launched the Safe 3, a hardware wallet aimed at "new entrants to crypto," alongside the new Keep Metal recovery seed storage device. We take a first look at what comes in the box.

entry.title: Why AI Arena is Building on Arbitrum
entry.summary: AI Arena CEO Brandon Da Silva and COO Wei Xie discuss the challenges that come with building on Ethereum, ETH sidechains, and layer-two blockchains.

entry.title: Pet3rPan_ on venture DAOs and blockchain games
entry.summary:
Welcome to the 4th episode of this time will be different.

entry.title: Inside Shrapnel's Marketplace, New Map, and 'AI Director' Feature
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin chats with Shrapnel's Head of Studio Don Norbury to get the latest updates on how the NFT-powered first-person sci-fi extraction shooter's development is progressing.

entry.title: 'Art of the Times': Art Blocks Founder Erick Calderon on the State of Generative Art
entry.summary: Art Blocks founder and CEO Erick Calderon sat down with Sander Lutz, lead culture reporter at Decrypt's SCENE, at Art Blocks Marfa Weekend 2023. They discuss the evolution of the company and the generative art world, along with what draws art enthusiasts to be an active part of the community.

entry.title: Decrypt Learn: Digital Ownership Explained
entry.summary: One of the most powerful aspects of blockchain technology is its ability to provide us genuine ownership of our digital assets. This is called digital ownership. In this video, we‚Äôll deep dive into digital ownership, why it matters, and how web3 makes owning digital assets like our social networks, music libraries, personal data, and beyond possible. Author: Clarissa Watson, Senior Writer at Consensys.

entry.title: Martin Shkreli on E/ACC and SBF in Prison
entry.summary: Reza Jafery and Martin Shkreli sit down for a casual conversation about the growing movement that is E/ACC, what songs they could recite at gunpoint, and whether or not SBF will thrive or just survive during his time in prison.

entry.title: What Can AI Do in Gaming?
entry.summary: AI Arena CEO Brandon Da Silva and COO Wei Xie discuss how artificial intelligence can shape the video game experience.
